title.narrative: Capacity-building for a clean energy transition of the household energy sector in the Democratic People#s Republic of Korea

description.narrative:
Upon request from the Permanent Mission of DPRK for technical assistance, a fact-finding mission was undertaken by UNIDO’s ENE Department. During the mission, a series of consultations were held between UNIDO experts and key stakeholders responsible for the household energy sector and renewable energy research and development in the country. This included the key counterpart Ministry of Commerce, Kim Il Sung University, the Academy of Sciences and its key institution, namely, the Institute for Natural Energy (INE). During the mission, various stakeholders highlighted the new Energy Policy of the government to accelerate the deployment of renewable energy technologies to tackle climate change and associated negative environmental impacts facing the country.
This project seeks to provide technical assistance for scaling up the deployment of renewable energy technologies and application in the household sector. The project was prepared in response to the request submitted to UNIDO by Permanent Mission of DPRK in Vienna, and consultations made with key stakeholders in the country during a fact-finding mission fielded by the Energy Department (ENE) in response to the request. The demand for affordable, reliable, sustainable and efficient energy services for all sectors is increasing in the country. The 2019 New Year Address made by Comrade Kim Jung Un, Chairman of the State Affairs Commission of DPRK, stated we should take the problem of easing the strain on electricity as an undertaking of the whle state, step up the construction of hydroelectic power stations including Orangchon and Tanchon power stations and create a capacity for generating tidal, wind and atomic power under a far-reaching plan. Provinces, cities and counties should develop and utilize in an effective way various energy sources available in their local areas. The project envisages a series of comprehensive capacity building programmes (both institutional and human) in utilizing abundantly available renewable energy resources in the country, such as solar, wind, SHP, biomass and geothermal to curb the negative sustainability impacts of coal usage in the country, especially in the household energy sector. It is expected that this project will fast-track clean energy transition of household energy sector in DPRK by enhancing the technical capacity of relevant Government Ministries and agencies responsible for energy access in the country. UNIDO intends to utilize its network of sustainable energy technology institutions around the world for achieving the objectives of this project. The project assists in promoting and furthering South-South cooperation through building better networks and exploring more opportunities in the areas of renewable energy technology.
